abstract: Charter Communications defends its proposed takeover of Time Warner Cable and Bright House Networks, trying to differentiate $67.1 billion bid from previous attempt by Comcast that was scuttled by regulators; filing with Federal Communications Commission makes argument that newly-formed company would have no incentive to hurt competition because it does not own any major broadcast or cable outlets.
lead_paragraph: Charter wants to buy Time Warner Cable and Bright House. In an F.C.C. filing, it outlined why its ownership would be beneficial, all the while dissociating itself from Comcast’s failed takeover.

headline.main: Charter Makes Its Case for 2 Mergers, Telling F.C.C. It’s No Comcast
headline.print_headline: Charter Makes Its Case for 2 Mergers, Telling F.C.C. It’s No Comcast

snippet: Charter wants to buy Time Warner Cable and Bright House. In an F.C.C. filing, it outlined why its ownership would be beneficial, all the while dissociating itself from Comcast’s failed takeover.
